SEARCH

Class DrStarks

java.lang.Object
DrStarks
public class DrStarks extends Object
The Therapist class (Dr. Starks) simulates a conversation with a user to provide therapy. Dr. Starks gets his name from "The Analyst", a novel by John Katzenbach. The class prompts the user for their emotional state and responds with a series of follow-up questions based on the user's responses. The class uses an instance of the Utils class to validate user input and normalize responses.
Since:
03/13/2023
Author:
Matt Magnaye and Pedro Orellana

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method for the Therapist program. Displays a greeting message, prompts the user for their emotional state, and begins the therapy session.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments for the program (not used)

    • displayGreeting

      public static void displayGreeting()
      Displays a greeting message to the user.

    • getInitialResponse

      public static String getInitialResponse()
      Prompts the user for their emotional state and normalizes their response.
      Returns:
      a normalized String representing the user's emotional state

    • therapySession

      public static String therapySession(String response)
      Handles the main logic for the therapy session. Asks the user a series of follow-up questions based on their response to the initial question.
      Parameters:
      response - a String representing the user's response to the initial question
      Returns:
      a String representing the user's final response to the session (e.g., "goodbye")
